qas.question: What framework did Dominic use in order to build his institution?
In what year did Dominic order his followers into an institutional life?
Who was the successor to Dominic?
What did the Rule of St. Augustine believe in?
What framework did Dominic not use in order to stifle his institution?
What year did Diego order his followers into an institutional life?
What did the Rule of St. Augustine not believe in?
What were the Dominican Brothers not?
Who could not practice ministry and common life while existing in poverty?

context: In July <a1_0><b6_0>1215<b6_0/><a1_0/>, with the approbation of Bishop Foulques of Toulouse, Dominic ordered his followers into an institutional life. Its purpose was revolutionary in the pastoral ministry of the Catholic Church. These priests were organized and well trained in religious studies. Dominic needed a framework—a rule—to organize these components. The <a0_0><b5_0>Rule of St. Augustine<b5_0/><a0_0/> was an obvious choice for the Dominican Order, according to Dominic's successor, <a2_0>Jordan of Saxony<a2_0/>, because it lent itself to <a3_0><b7_0>the "salvation of souls through preaching<b7_0/>"<a3_0/>. By this choice, however, the <b9_0>Dominican brothers<b9_0/> designated themselves not monks, but <a4_0><b8_0>canons-regular<b8_0/><a4_0/>. They could practice ministry and common life while existing in individual poverty.
